body_html:
We do not have official support for Redhat, or Anaconda. So I am marking this community support.

However, the following is possible.
It is possible anaconda python and tensorflow are looking for different versions of glibc.
Could you install pip and python through RPM and try again?
body_text:
We do not have official support for Redhat, or Anaconda. So I am marking this community support.
However, the following is possible.
It is possible anaconda python and tensorflow are looking for different versions of glibc.
Could you install pip and python through RPM and try again?
body:
We do not have official support for Redhat, or Anaconda. So I am marking this community support.

However, the following is possible.
It is possible anaconda python and tensorflow are looking for different versions of glibc.
Could you install pip and python through RPM and try again?
